page.title: 01Grimethorpe
page.content: Grimethorpe is a rural village with industry. It is said that it is the most heavily industrialised village in Europe. All the industry is concentrated in the southwest corner of the village where you will find ,a deep mine ,a drift mine (linking Grimethorpe to other deep mines)one power station ,a Coalite and chemical plant,a huge coal preparation plant, and a brickyard.Four hundred metres towards Shafton lies the N.C.B. area workshops and stores. It is difficult to state the exact population of Grimethorpe as the census figures are always given as Brierley with Grimethorpe but a good guess would be 5000.The population was quite small until 1893 when the shaft of the first deep mine was started.The population has grown steadily and now is greater than that of Brierley.
